issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
1. Run the app as steps below 
Copy the App files from 'test/apps/ui/coverflow' from https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/tree/master/test/apps/ui/coverflow into alloy project and execute the project in the browser

Expected:
App should run

Actual:
./index.html not found error occurs
fields.summary: MobileWeb: /index.html not found error while running in browser
fields.environment:
Tested on:
SDK: 3.3.0.v20140528144113
CLI version : 3.3.0-beta2
OS : MAC OSX 10.9.2
Alloy:  1.4.0-beta
ACS: 1.0.14
npm:1.3.2
LiveView: 1.0.4
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201405271647
titanium-code-processor: 1.1.1
XCode : 5.1.1

comments.body: [~emerriman] Triage QE, please. Is it related to this issue? TISTUD-5893.

Tested 
Mac osx 10.9.3 Mavericks
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201405271647
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140605150555 
Node.JS Version: v0.10.13 
NPM Version: 1.3.2 
acs@1.0.14 
alloy@1.4.0-beta2 
npm@1.3.2 
titanium@3.3.0-beta2 
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1

1. Followed steps from [~pmishra] comments
Created the default Alloy project, replaced folders
Run> Mobile Web Preview in browser
2. Packaged app for mobile web
Open app in iPhone5C browser
h5.Actual result - white screen with the label

I was not able to reproduce the bug where index.html was not found. This is possible if the Studio's built-in web server dies.

I was able to reproduce the message that says "Ti.UI.iOS.CoverFlowView only supported on iOS". As the message states, Mobile Web does not support it, thus I'm resolving this ticket as invalid.
Please move tickets into your sprint before resolving them.
